name: QuickSilver (Marioalexsan)
description:
A simple top-down shooter written in Java for an university project, where you can shoot your enemies (or friends) in a multiplayer arena.

Controls:

  • WASD - Move around
  • Left Mouse Button - Primary Fire
  • Right Mouse Button - Secondary Fire (for Shotgun)
  • R - Reload current Weapon
    • Firing with an empty gun will also reload it
  • 1 - Switch to Revolver
  • 2 - Switch to Rifle
  • 3 - Switch to Shotgun
  • Shift - Dash
    • This makes you move faster and gives you invulnerability frames!
  • Escape - Enter the in-game menu (for quitting, mostly)
  • Enter - Allows you to chat with other players while in-game

You can configure the game in the Settings Menu. Some of the Settings include:

  • FOV Factor - this allows you to "see" further as you move the mouse around. Is set at "None" by default.
  • User Name - this is what is displayed when you connect to a game

To connect to a multiplayer game, you need to port forward ports 52735 TCP, and 52216 UDP. Clients need to enter the IP of the server they want to connect to.
